name: Bulgarian Split Squat
how_to_perform:
1. Start by standing about two feet in front of a bench or a sturdy elevated surface. 
2. Extend your right leg behind you and place the top of your right foot on the bench. This will be your starting position.
3. Keep your torso upright and engage your core muscles.
4. Lower your body by bending your left knee, keeping your right foot on the bench. Descend until your left thigh is parallel to the ground, ensuring that your knee does not extend past your toes.
5. Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement.
6. Press through your left heel to return to the starting position, ensuring that you keep your balance.
7. Complete the desired number of repetitions, then switch legs and repeat the process with your left leg elevated.
short_summary: The Bulgarian Split Squat is a lower body exercise targeting the quadriceps, glutes, and hamstrings performed with one leg elevated behind.
